item.title: Critical Role Series: Attendance
item.description: Spell Ingredients This spell is written in the R language, and requires: magrittr dplyr tidyr tibble ggplot2 ggthemes Introduction This is a short exploratory data analysis of attendance on the web series Critical Role, in which voice actors play Dungeons and Dragoooooooons! It is a fantastic show, and some of the amazing people at Crit Role Stats have been tracking “monster stats, dice rolls, and anything else that can be quantified on Critical Role”.

item.title: Critical Role Series: Kiri Imitations
item.description: Ingredients This spell is made in the R language, and requires these packages: magrittr dplyr stringr ggplot2 Introduction This is part of a just-for-fun series using data on the Dungeons and Dragons streaming show, Critical Role. The amazing people at Crit Role Stats have logged and analyzed data about various aspects of the show, from dice rolls to character stats to in-game puns. The show is on hiatus due to COVID-19 so in the usual timeslot when I would have been watching Critical Role, I’ve been having some fun visualizing some of the data tracked by Crit Role Stats.

item.title: Critical Role Series: Kiri Imitations (Old)
item.description: UPDATE Please find an updated version of this post here. When I first made these graphs, I was still early in the storyline of campaign 2. Some aspects of the graphs have now been updated to use characters’ true names. Ingredients This spell is made in the R language, and requires these packages: magrittr dplyr stringr ggplot2 Introduction This is part of a just-for-fun series using data on the Dungeons and Dragons streaming show, Critical Role.
